title: The Butterfly Life Cycle
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 520 words, Level N (Grade 2), Lexile 590L

description: A monarch butterfly changes from egg to caterpillar, then to pupa, and finally to butterfly in The Butterfly Life Cycle. Vivid photographs illustrate this process. The book can also be used to teach students how to sequence events in a text and how to apply subject-verb agreement. The book and lesson are also available for levels H and K.
highFrequencyWords: larva, life cycle, mate, molting, pupa, stages
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Long Vowels                : Identify the long vowel /i/ sound
awareness: Subject-Verb Agreement                : Understand and apply subject-verb agreement
phonics: Number Words                : Read and understand number words
grammar:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
